Basics

Name Suren Gourapura
Email sureng@princeton.edu

Summary Interested in CMB data analysis

Work

  • 2024.09 - 2024.09
    Cosmoglobe Workshop Participant
    University of Oslo Bayesian Cosmological Data Analysis Course
    Learning to use Commander 3, an end-to-end Bayesian parameter estimator that combines data from multiple experiments
    • Applied SPIDER-1 data at the map level to Commander 3
  • 2019.07 - 2026.05
    Graduate Student
    Princeton University Department of Physics
    Working on the SPIDER and Taurus experiments
    • Pointing reconstruction for SPIDER-2 using CMB intensity fluctuations
    • Characterization of pointing errors using compact source statistics
    • Understanding scan synchronous noise
    • Development of data quality flags and statistics
    • Primary calibration and instrument parameters through CMB cross-correlation
    • SPIDER-2 integration and testing campaigns: Winter 2022-23 McMurdo Antarctica, Summer 2021 Palestine TX, Spring 2020 Princeton NJ
    • Tested various SPIDER-2 pointing strategies
    • Development of spectral domain component separation pipeline
    • Created unique divisions of the SPIDER sky and probed for correlations in existing cosmological data
    • Implementation and calibration of cryogenic housekeeping instrumentation
    • Mechanical design, testing, and assembly of flight photovoltaic arrays
    • Development and implementation of flight data storage system
    • Investigation of efficient, cryogenic filters for mitigation of RFI
  • 2018.05 - 2018.08
    Class Developer
    Big Data Analytics Project
    Helped create a new class, “Big Data” Analytics (Physics 6820)
    • Documented here: www.github.com/SummerBigData
    • Explored multivariate linear regression and logistic regression
    • Classified the MNIST digit dataset using a convolutional neural network (CNN) with learned features from an autoencoder (AE)
    • Classified 64x64 color images of cats, dogs, cars, and airplanes using a CNN with learned features from a color AE
    • Kaggle Challenge: Statoil/C-CORE Iceberg Classifier. Trained a CNN to distinguish radio images of icebergs or ships. Used filtering data augmentation, pseudolabeling, and a Variational AE.
    • Kaggle Challenge: Plant Seedling Classification. Trained a CNN to classify pictures of 12 plant seedlings. Used kfolds, t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding, and PCA data augmentation
  • 2016.07 - 2019.05
    Undergraduate Researcher
    Ohio State University Department of Physics
    Working on the Askaryan Radio Array (ARA)
    • Wrote a genetic algorithm to calibrate SURF data from Stanford Linear Accelerator Center (SLAC)
    • Wrote genetic algorithms to evolve wire antennas using gain and neutrino shower simulation software
    • Development of Askaryan Radio Array (ARA) hardware, firmware, and integration
    • Wrote genetic algorithms to fit spherical harmonic coefficients, generating directional antenna gain patterns
  • 2016.05 - 2016.07
    Summer Researcher
    Salmonella Nanoparticle Vaccine Internship
    Aided in developing a nanoparticle based subunit Salmonella oral vaccine to use in poultry to reduce colonization and shedding of Salmonella
    • Dissected and collected various organs, contents, and blood from over 60 chickens infected with the food poisoning bacteria Salmonella
    • Extracted DNA and RNA from cecal content and cecal tonsils for genetic analysis

Volunteer

  • 2021.06 - 2022.05

    Princeton, New Jersey

    Midwest Region Ambassador
    Equity Diversity Initiative: Grad Recruiting
    EDI initative helping undergraduate students learn about graduate student life, PhD research, and graduate applications
    • Helped develop and was hired as a paid Ambassador in the Princeton Physics Department’s EDI program
    • Created to actively reach out to undergraduate students and explain Physics Graduate school
    • Advised for undergraduate students in the midwest region
  • 2021.06 - 2022.05

    Princeton, New Jersey

    Volunteer/Organizer
    Equity Diversity Initiative: Grad Recruiting
    EDI initative borne from 2021 George Floyd marches. Targeted at removing barriers for underrepresented minorities to apply and attend the Princeton Physics graduate program
    • Interviewing students and editing the website to be more informative
    • Creating the Ambassadors group
    • Investigating the Physics Graduate Admissions Committee to search for ways to better identify student talent beyond their institution and GPA
  • 2018.06 - 2019.06

    Columbus, Ohio

    Volunteer/Organizer
    Highschool research opportunities for women
    Volunteered and coordinated research opportunities for women from local high schools
    • I presented my work on antenna genetic programming and guided them to evolve their own antennas with python
  • 2017.06 - 2017.07

    Columbus, Ohio

    Volunteer/Organizer
    Achieving in Science through Physics Instrumentation, Research, and Exploration (ASPIRE)
    Volunteered and coordinated a highschool program to get women from local highschools interested in physics
    • Set up an antenna experiment involving signal triangulation using oscilloscopes
    • Helped coordinate activities broadly and help students with their projects
